Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Situation2: They see a group of teenagers ignoring the no-diving signs near the pool edge.
Story: I sat beside Mia on the sun-warmed bench, her hand in mine, trying to memorize every detail of her smile. It was our last weekend together before she left for London, and I’d promised her my undivided attention. She leaned her head on my shoulder, and I felt the weight of time slipping away. But then, out of the corner of my eye, I spotted a group of teenagers at the pool’s edge, laughing and daring each other to dive where the signs clearly said not to. My lifeguard instincts kicked in—if I didn’t intervene, someone could get hurt, and it was my job to keep everyone safe. But if I left Mia now, even for a moment, I’d be breaking the promise I made to her, stealing precious minutes from our goodbye. My heart pounded as I glanced between her hopeful eyes and the reckless teens, torn between the duty I owed to my job and the love I owed to her.
